page.title: 02LANDSCAPE-RIVER DARENTH
page.content: he river Darent runs past our school field. Many of us live in Eynsford and Farningham which would probably not exist if it was not for our river. Relics of settlements have been found proving that man has always lived near it. Ancient Britons called it Durentio meaning oak river because then the valley was covered with oak trees. In our area there is an Anglo Saxon Burial ground and three Roman Villas so it has always been a good place for man to live. We have found out that the river used to be much wider and deeper, so ships could use it. The Domesday Book describes a fishery at Eynsford. Today the Darent is getting narrower. Last year we had a pageant in Farningham some people played Vikings who sailed up the river, which is impossible today.
